meanings.definition: A minor weakness or eccentricity in someone's character.
meanings.sent1: Her foibles included always being late to meetings.
meanings.sent2: Everyone has their own unique foibles that make them interesting.
meanings.sent3: His foibles made him endearing to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The foibles of human nature are what make us all so fascinating.
meanings.sent5: Despite her foibles, she was loved by all who knew her.

meanings.definition: A minor flaw or shortcoming in a plan or system.
meanings.sent1: The project's foibles were quickly identified and addressed.
meanings.sent2: It's important to recognize and fix any foibles in the system.
meanings.sent3: The foibles in the design caused some unexpected issues.
meanings.sent4: The foibles of the plan became apparent during the implementation phase.
meanings.sent5: Addressing the foibles early on can prevent bigger problems later.
